intro: Lecanocarpus nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal lecanocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
